title: Tips & Trikx: 'Pawfect' shots in 8K
description: Tech influencer sensation, ASBYT, shares six simple steps to capturing and editing photos in 8K
alt: A person holding the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a landscape orientation with two hands views a close up photo of a grey cat lying down in front of a green blurred background.

text: Tech influencer and YouTube vlogger Adam Butcher shares six simple steps to capturing and editing photos in 8K using the Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra.
Firstly, you will need to capture the 8K video. To do this, open your camera app on the Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra and head to your video tab.

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a portrait orientationin in front of a bush. The camera of the smartphone is on, capturing the bush in front of it. A yellow circle and arrow are pictured around the video button.

text: Click on the settings cog at the top left-hand side and scroll down to the videos section.

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a portrait orientationin in front of a bush. The camera of the smartphone is on, capturing the bush in front of it. A yellow circle and arrow are pictured around the settings button on the phone screen.

text: Select 'rear video size' and under the '16:9' section click on 'resolution' and make sure its set to 8K.

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a portrait orientationin in front of a bush. On the phone screen, the camera settings are open with a yellow circle and arrow pointing towards the rear video size setting.

text: Once you've captured your video footage, go to your gallery, and select the video you want to capture your stills from.

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a portrait orientationin in front of a garden. On the phone screen, a gallery of photos and vifdeos are shown. A yellow circle and arrow are pictured pointing towards one video in the photo and video gallery pictured on screen.

text: When selected, click 'play video' and scrub through until you find your desired shot.

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a landscape orientationin in front of a garden. On the phone screen, a video of a grey cat lying down on the floor is pictured, with a yellow circle and arrow pictured to highlight how to scrub through a video

text: Once you’ve found it, press the photo icon at the top left-hand side. Once snapped, you will now have that photo in your gallery to enjoy!

components.alt: Two hands hold the smartphone Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra in a landscape orientationin in front of a garden. On the phone screen, a video of a grey cat lying down on the floor is shown, with a yellow circle and arrow arround the photo gallery icon in the top left hand corner of the screen

text: Snap and share your 8K shots with #SamsungKX
